KUMobile.name: KUMobile
KUMobile.description: Contains all generic functions, events, and feature classes.

KUMobile.name: KUMobile
KUMobile.description: Contains all generic functions, events, and feature classes.

KUMobile.Announcements.name: KUMobile.Announcements
KUMobile.Announcements.description:
Contains all announcements related functions for loading and controlling the
announcements page.

KUMobile.Config.name: KUMobile.Config
KUMobile.Config.description: Contains configuration settings for the KUMobile project

KUMobile.Directory.name: KUMobile.Directory
KUMobile.Directory.description:
Contains all directory related functions for loading and controlling the
directory page. This only takes faculty directory into consideration.

KUMobile.Events.name: KUMobile.Events
KUMobile.Events.description:
Contains all events related functions for loading and controlling the events
page.

KUMobile.FileIO.name: KUMobile.FileIO
KUMobile.FileIO.description:
Local file control used to make saving and reading files MUCH easier then the
plugin allows for.

KUMobile.Library.name: KUMobile.Library
KUMobile.Library.description:
Contains all library related functions for loading and controlling the
library page.

KUMobile.Map.name: KUMobile.Map
KUMobile.Map.description:
Contains all map related functions for loading and controlling the
map page.

KUMobile.Map.POICategory.name: KUMobile.Map.POICategory
KUMobile.Map.POICategory.description: Full POI data for a category.

KUMobile.News.name: KUMobile.News
KUMobile.News.description: Contains all news related functions for loading and controlling the news page.

KUMobile.Student.name: KUMobile.Student
KUMobile.Student.description:
Contains all student related functions for loading and controlling the
student driven.

KUMobile.Transfer.name: KUMobile.Transfer
KUMobile.Transfer.description:
Contains all transfer related functions for loading and controlling the
transfer page.

classitems.description:
Contains the version information loaded from the app manifest! Note: this
is only available after the device ready function is called, until then 
it is null
classitems.name: version

classitems.description: Event triggered after the home page initialization!
classitems.name: ready

classitems.description:
Event triggered when the device is ready, registered with "deviceready".
The primary purpose is to determine what type of device we are on (Android,
iOS, Windows). Note: this is only triggered if you are ON a device!
classitems.name: ready

classitems.description: Displays the loading indicator on the page with the given id
classitems.name: showLoading

params.name: id
params.description: - identifier for which page to show indicator on

classitems.description: Hides the loading indicator on the page with the given id
classitems.name: hideLoading

params.name: id
params.description: - identifier for which page to show indicator on

classitems.description:
Converts a state name from abbreviation to full state name. If the
conversion does not work it will simply return the abbreviation to be safe!
classitems.name: convertStateToFull

params.name: abr
params.description: - state abbreviation to convert to full state

classitems.description:
Binds a jquery event safely by first removing any prexisting event! This
prevents it from being binded twice.
classitems.name: safeBinder

params.name: query
params.description: - jquery query for element to bind

params.name: callback
params.description: - function to be called on event trigger

classitems.description: Scrolls an overflow container to a certain element
classitems.name: scrollTo

classitems.description:
Resize function to link to jQM event for throttled resize. The purpose is
that this resize function is controlled to not occur *too quickly* and
advanced resizing can be done here. Alternative to this is just to use 
css calc(), but not fully supported across all target devices as of
time of development (2/26/2015).
classitems.name: throttledResize

classitems.description: Adds a 'new' indicator for every selected element
classitems.name: addNewIndicator

params.name: selector
params.description: - query string to add indicators to

classitems.description:
Triggered any time a page is changed as registered by jQuery Mobile. 
The primary purpose is to allow us to resize to be safe that all elements 
are scaled properly.
classitems.name: pageChange

classitems.description: Current page number as referenced from the announcements website.
classitems.name: page

classitems.description: Number of pages to load from the website after a trigger event occurs.
classitems.name: PAGES_TO_LOAD

classitems.description: Is the announcements page loading?
classitems.name: loading

classitems.description:
Designates the minimum number of pixels that the user can scroll
(calculated from the bottom) before another load event is triggered.
classitems.name: LOAD_THRESHOLD_PX

classitems.description:
How many pages that need to be downloaded still. This is used to asynchronously
download pages.
classitems.name: queue

classitems.description:
Contains the current list of article DOM <li> tag items that still need
to be added to the DOM (much faster to add all at once after load
is done downloading). This helps prevent the application from seeming to 
hang or become unresponsive.
classitems.name: listQueue

classitems.description:
Triggered when the announcements page is first initialized based on jQuery 
Mobile pageinit event.
classitems.name: pageInit

classitems.description:
Triggered when the announcements page is first created based on jQuery Mobile
pagecreate event. This is called after the page itself is created but 
before any jQuery Mobile styling is applied.
classitems.name: pageCreate

classitems.description:
Triggered when regular scroll event happens in announcements scroller window. 
It is used to check if the user is *near* the bottom of the page, so more
content can be loaded (simulate *infinite scrolling*).
classitems.name: scroll

classitems.description: Loads and displays the next set of items.
classitems.name: loadNextPage

classitems.description:
Delay for loading minimum time (ms) for loading indicator to show for. This 
was mainly useful to prevent the indicator confusingly flashing.
classitems.name: LOAD_INDICATOR_DELAY

classitems.description:
Is this a device (otherwise assume its a browser/emulator). Some plugins
cannot be used in a browser/emulator and thereby must be determined during
runtime.
classitems.name: isDevice

classitems.description: Quick access boolean to determine if the device is of Android platform.
classitems.name: isAndroid

classitems.description: Quick access boolean to determine if the device is of iOs platform.
classitems.name: isIOS

classitems.description: Quick access boolean to determine if the device is of Windows platform.
classitems.name: isWindows

classitems.description: Default wait time (ms) for incremental searching.
classitems.name: DEFAULT_INCR_WAIT_TIME

classitems.description: Current page number as referenced from the directory website.
classitems.name: page

classitems.description: Number of pages to load from the directory website after a trigger event occurs.
classitems.name: PAGES_TO_LOAD

classitems.description: Is the directory page loading?
classitems.name: loading

classitems.description:
Designates the minimum number of pixels that the user can scroll
(calculated from the bottom) before another load event is triggered.
classitems.name: LOAD_THRESHOLD_PX

classitems.description:
The latest topic identifier for Kettering's directory searching. This 
represents the department the user has selected to filter by.
classitems.name: tid

classitems.description: Represents the last value the user has searched for in the directory
classitems.name: lastValue

classitems.description: Tells whether or not the user has reached the end of the scrolling.
classitems.name: reachedEnd

classitems.description: Is the user currently typing?
classitems.name: typing

classitems.description:
How many pages that need to be downloaded still. This is used to asynchronously
download pages.
classitems.name: queue

classitems.description:
Contains the current list of article DOM <li> tag items that still need
to be added to the DOM (much faster to add all at once after load
is done downloading). This helps prevent the application from seeming to 
hang or become unresponsive.
classitems.name: listQueue

classitems.description:
Contains the last timeout call sent. This allows us to restart the timeout if
the user re-searches in any way (dropdown, or searchbar). The major benefit
of this is that it gives us the feeling of incremental searching, e.g we send
a timeout of some milliseconds whenever the KEY_UP event triggers, as well
as cancelling out the last timeout we sent.
classitems.name: sentTimeout

classitems.description: Deobfuscation method to properly interpret directory information
classitems.name: deobfuscate

classitems.description:
Triggered when the directory page is first initialized based on jQuery Mobile
pageinit event.
classitems.name: pageInit

classitems.description:
Triggered when the directory page is first created based on jQuery Mobile
pagecreate event. This is called after the page itself is created but 
before any jQuery Mobile styling is applied.
classitems.name: pageCreate

classitems.description:
Triggered when the user does a key up event in order to simulate incremental
searching for the attached search bar.
classitems.name: incrementalSearch

classitems.description:
Triggered when the user does a direct change. The direct change includes 
typing then changing focus or pressing the clear button. This is redundant
to the incremental search event, *except for the clear button!!*
classitems.name: directSearch

classitems.description:
Triggered when the user does a change to the TID/department drop down box.
When this happens, we generally need to redo the search.
classitems.name: tidChange

classitems.description:
Triggered when regular scroll event happens in directory scroller window. It 
is used to check if the user is *near* the bottom of the page, so more
content can be loaded (simulate *infinite scrolling*).
classitems.name: scroll

classitems.description: Loads and displays the next set of directory items.
classitems.name: loadNextPage

classitems.description:
Reinitializes all properties of KUMobile.Directory as if to restore
a new/default instance.
classitems.name: reinitialize

classitems.description: Current page number as referenced from the events website.
classitems.name: page

classitems.description: Number of pages to load from the events website after a trigger event occurs.
classitems.name: PAGES_TO_LOAD

classitems.description: Is the events page loading?
classitems.name: loading

classitems.description:
Designates the minimum number of pixels that the user can scroll
(calculated from the bottom) before another load event is triggered.
classitems.name: LOAD_THRESHOLD_PX

classitems.description:
How many pages that need to be downloaded still. This is used to asynchronously
download pages.
classitems.name: queue

classitems.description:
Contains the current list of article DOM <li> tag items that still need
to be added to the DOM (much faster to add all at once after load
is done downloading). This helps prevent the application from seeming to 
hang or become unresponsive.
classitems.name: listQueue

classitems.description:
Contains the current list of pages DOM data-role="page" 
items that still need to be added to the DOM (much faster to 
add all at once after load is done downloading). This helps 
prevent the app from seeming to hang or become unresponsive.
classitems.name: pageQueue

classitems.description:
The latest divider month & day combo is kept track of as an easy way to
know when a datebar needs to be added!
classitems.name: pageQueue

classitems.description:
Triggered when the events page is first initialized based on jQuery Mobile
pageinit event.
classitems.name: pageInit

classitems.description:
Triggered when the events page is first created based on jQuery Mobile
pagecreate event. This is called after the page itself is created but 
before any jQuery Mobile styling is applied.
classitems.name: pageCreate

classitems.description:
Triggered when regular scroll event happens in events scroller window. It 
is used to check if the user is *near* the bottom of the page, so more
content can be loaded (simulate *infinite scrolling*).
classitems.name: scroll

classitems.description: Loads and displays the next set of events items.
classitems.name: loadNextPage

classitems.description:
Called on create of an article page. Mainly this function just
attempts to download the article and show it.
classitems.name: articlePageCreate

classitems.description:
Enables debug messages via alert messages. Do NOT enable this unless there
are legitimate problems with plugins (not available to debug via browser).
classitems.name: debug

classitems.description: Name of the current file.
classitems.name: fileName

classitems.description: Contents of current file (the entire point of reading)
classitems.name: fileContents

classitems.description: Method to callback on any failure
classitems.name: failCallback

classitems.description: Method to callback on complete success.
classitems.name: successCallback

classitems.description: Writes contents to file with proper callbacks.

params.name: content
params.description: - what we want to save (usually JSON string)

classitems.name: writeToFile

classitems.description: Reads contents from file with proper callbacks.
classitems.name: readFromFile

classitems.description: Triggered after file system is retrieved
classitems.name: read_GotFS

classitems.description: Triggered after file entry is retrieved
classitems.name: read_GotFileEntry

classitems.description: Triggered after file is retrieved
classitems.name: read_GotFile

classitems.description: Triggered after file is ready to be read from
classitems.name: read_ReadAsText

classitems.description: Triggered after file system is ready
classitems.name: write_GotFS

classitems.description: Triggered after file entry is ready
classitems.name: write_GotFileEntry

classitems.description: Triggered after file writer is ready
classitems.name: write_GotFileWriter

classitems.description: Triggered any time a failure occurs
classitems.name: fail

classitems.description: Triggered any time a failure occurs
classitems.name: clear

classitems.description: Current page number as referenced from the library website.
classitems.name: page

classitems.description: Is the library page loading?
classitems.name: loading

classitems.description:
Designates the minimum number of pixels that the user can scroll
(calculated from the bottom) before another load event is triggered.
classitems.name: LOAD_THRESHOLD_PX

classitems.description:
Type of searching for Kettering's library. Represents the method of 
searching that will be used by the system.
classitems.name: type

classitems.description: Represents the last value the user has searched for in the library
classitems.name: lastValue

classitems.description: Tells whether or not the user has reached the end of the scrolling.
classitems.name: reachedEnd

classitems.description: Is the user currently typing?
classitems.name: typing

classitems.description:
Contains the current list of article DOM <li> tag items that still need
to be added to the DOM (much faster to add all at once after load
is done downloading). This helps prevent the application from seeming to 
hang or become unresponsive.
classitems.name: listQueue

classitems.description:
Contains the last timeout call sent. This allows us to restart the timeout if
the user re-searches in any way (dropdown, or searchbar). The major benefit
of this is that it gives us the feeling of incremental searching, e.g we send
a timeout of some milliseconds whenever the KEY_UP event triggers, as well
as cancelling out the last timeout we sent.
classitems.name: sentTimeout

classitems.description:
Triggered when the library page is first initialized based on jQuery Mobile
pageinit event. This is called after the page itself is created and 
initialized, therefore it is proper to do the event bindings here.
classitems.name: pageInit

classitems.description:
Triggered when the library page is first created based on jQuery Mobile
pagecreate event. This is called after the page itself is created but 
before any jQuery Mobile styling is applied.
classitems.name: pageCreate

classitems.description:
Triggered when the user does a key up event in order to simulate incremental
searching for the attached search bar.
classitems.name: incrementalSearch

classitems.description:
Triggered when the user does a direct change. The direct change includes 
typing then changing focus or pressing the clear button. This is redundant
to the incremental search event, *except for the clear button!!*
classitems.name: directSearch

classitems.description:
Triggered when the user does a change to the category drop down box.
When this happens, we generally need to redo the search.
classitems.name: categoryChange

classitems.description:
Triggered when regular scroll event happens in library scroller window. It 
is used to check if the user is *near* the bottom of the page, so more
content can be loaded (simulate *infinite scrolling*).
classitems.name: scroll

classitems.description: Loads and displays the next set of library items.
classitems.name: loadNextPage

classitems.description:
Reinitializes all properties of KUMobile.Library as if to restore
a new/default instance.
classitems.name: reinitialize

classitems.description: The leaflet map object
classitems.name: map

classitems.description: The latest user location (if any).
classitems.name: userLocation

classitems.description:
Tells whether or not map is currently attempting to download
or parse article lists. Essentially used to tell whether map is
considered to be busy.
classitems.name: loading

classitems.description: Starting center of the map as a coordinate array.
classitems.name: START_CENTER

classitems.description:
List of POI categories (order that they will be downloaded in) containing the
corresponding foursquare ID's.
classitems.name: CATEGORIES_LIST

classitems.description: Stores the data for each POI category.
classitems.name: categoryData

classitems.description: All current POI markers that are currently added to the map.
classitems.name: markers

classitems.description:
Contains the last timeout call sent. This allows us to restart the timeout if
the user re-searches in any way (dropdown, or searchbar). The major benefit
of this is that it gives us the feeling of incremental searching, e.g we send
a timeout of some milliseconds whenever the KEY_UP event triggers, as well
as cancelling out the last timeout we sent.
classitems.name: sentTimeout

classitems.description:
Southwest latitude for map's bounding box. Essentially most southwest
latitude for POI's we are concerned with to show the user.
classitems.name: BB_SWLAT

classitems.description:
Southwest longitude for map's bounding box. Essentially most southwest
longitude for POI's we are concerned with to show the user.
classitems.name: BB_SWLNG

classitems.description:
Northeast latitude for map's bounding box. Essentially most northeast
latitude for POI's we are concerned with to show the user.
classitems.name: BB_NELAT

classitems.description:
Northeast longitude for map's bounding box. Essentially most northeast
longitude for POI's we are concerned with to show the user.
classitems.name: BB_NELNG

classitems.description:
The index related to categories for which we are currently downloading or
importing from a cached session.
classitems.name: downloadIndex

classitems.description:
The 'version' of how we save map data to local filesystem. Whenever the
structure of this changes, we must change the serialized ID. When we notice
the ID change a new download will be triggered!
classitems.name: SERIALIZE_ID

classitems.description:
Represents the last value the user has searched for from the free text field
search bar located on the map page.
classitems.name: lastValue

classitems.description:
Wait time for incremental searching. This distinguishes how long to wait 
after the user has searched something, before we assume they are done typing.
classitems.name: INCR_WAIT_TIME

classitems.description:
This is the minimum time that needs to have passed in order to allow for 
another foursquare update to both the map and local filesystem.
classitems.name: MIN_UPDATE_MS

classitems.description:
File template for local storage of foursquare map data for each category.
E.g for saving food it would be MAP_DATA_Food filename.
classitems.name: MAP_FILE_TEMPLATE

classitems.description:
Enables debug messages via alert messages. Do NOT enable this unless there
are legitimate problems with plugins (not available to debug via browser).
classitems.name: debug

classitems.description:
Is the footer showing? The footer contains the POI details and starts off
hidden. It is only shown when the user clicks on the POI or searches.
classitems.name: footerVisible

classitems.description:
Contains the selected marker. This is useful to store so we can easily
disable the markers selection.
classitems.name: selectedMarker

classitems.description: Name of the POI category
classitems.name: name

classitems.description: Serialized ID of the app when the data was downloaded.
classitems.name: serializeID

classitems.description: Date integer in milliseconds.
classitems.name: date

classitems.description:
List of all POIs for the category. The array type is a foursquare POI item
based on their venue search API.
classitems.name: pois

classitems.description: Icon name to be used as the map marker
classitems.name: icon

classitems.description:
Triggered when the map page is first initialized based on jQuery Mobile
pageinit event.
classitems.name: pageInit

classitems.description:
Triggered when the map page is first created based on jQuery Mobile
pagecreate event. This is called after the page itself is created but 
before any jQuery Mobile styling is applied.
classitems.name: pageCreate

classitems.description:
Triggered when the user does a key up event in order to simulate incremental
searching for the attached search bar.
classitems.name: incrementalSearch

classitems.description:
Triggered when the user does a direct change. The direct change includes 
typing then changing focus or pressing the clear button. This is redundant
to the incremental search event, *except for the clear button!!*
classitems.name: directSearch

classitems.description: Removes all markers from the map and then clears them from the array.
classitems.name: clearMarkers

classitems.description:
User has clicked the map. We can use this as a way to exit the footer! Then
also deselect the marker
classitems.name: mapClick

classitems.description:
User's location was found! Add it to the map as a blue circle including
an accuracy circle.
classitems.name: locationfound

classitems.description: Updates POI data for every category in the category list.
classitems.name: updatePOIData

classitems.description:
Reads POI's from local file system. Note that if this fails, we will 
attempt to download the failed category!
classitems.name: readPOIData

classitems.description: Triggered after a successful read of POI file.
classitems.name: readPOI_Success

classitems.description: Triggered after a failed read of POI file.
classitems.name: readPOI_Fail

classitems.description: Filters the map POI's to only add markers that the user searched for!
classitems.name: filterMap

classitems.description:
Add POI's of a certain category to the map if it is a match with the 
user's input through the search bar.
classitems.name: addPOIs

params.name: category
params.description:
- the category data containing 
        the POIs to be searched through and added upon match

classitems.description: Triggered when the user clicks on a POI marker.
classitems.name: markerClick

classitems.description:
Deselects the currently selected marker from the map. Basically it only
switches the icon back to the 'non-selected' icon.
classitems.name: markerClick

classitems.description: Shows the footer with POI detail information at the bottom of the map.
classitems.name: showPOIDetails

params.name: poi
params.description:
- the point of interest as returned through foursquare
        venue search API

classitems.description: Initialize the leaflet map with category data, list and basic settings.
classitems.name: initializeMap

classitems.description: Populates the schedule planner results page with the next working schedule
classitems.name: nextWorkingSchedule

classitems.description: Populates the schedule planner results page with the previous working schedule
classitems.name: previousWorkingSchedule

classitems.description:
Parses time from a pattern like 8:00 AM-9:05 AM. Returns an object with 
"start" and "end" properties representing the minutes past midnight rounded
to the nearest 15 minute interval.

params.name: timeStr
params.description: - the time range to parse from

classitems.name: parseTime

classitems.description: Tests courses to see if a course list works with the provided course

params.name: courses
params.description:
- the course list which is known to work, type 
    KetteringJS.Student.JWEB.CatalogEntry[]

params.name: course
params.description:
- the course to be tested with, type 
    KetteringJS.Student.JWEB.CatalogEntry

classitems.name: testCourses

classitems.description: Generates and returns a div with a table and corresponding popups based on courses

params.name: courses
params.description: - the course data returned by KetteringJS retrieveSchedule

classitems.name: generateScheduleTable

classitems.description: Populates final grades page based on returned information.
classitems.name: populateFinalGrades

classitems.description: Populates degree evaluation page based on returned information.
classitems.name: populateDegreeEvaluation

classitems.description: Adds a planner course to the set of courses
classitems.name: addPlannerCourse

classitems.description: Toggles the term type between plain text (Winter 2015) and integer (201501)

params.name: input
params.description: - text to be toggled, both formats accepted

classitems.name: toggleTermType

classitems.description: Tries to guess which term it is based on today's current date (e.g 201501)
classitems.name: guessTerm

classitems.description: Attempts to open a file. Triggered after an attached file link is clicked.
classitems.name: openFile

classitems.description: Populates course folder page based on a given content tree.
classitems.name: populateFolderPage

classitems.description: Triggered when a new evaluation generate button is clicked
classitems.name: degreeEvaluationGenerate

classitems.description: Triggered when a term for schedule planner page is selected from drop down
classitems.name: schedulePlannerTermChange

classitems.description: Triggered when a term for schedule page is selected from drop down
classitems.name: scheduleTermChange

classitems.description: Triggered when a term for final grades is selected from drop down
classitems.name: finalGradesTermChange

classitems.description: Triggered when a new evaluation is selected to be loaded from the drop down
classitems.name: degreeEvaluationChange

classitems.description: Failure for generic errors on the student page
classitems.name: failure

classitems.description:
Triggered when the sign in button is pressed and we attempt to login to all
student services!
classitems.name: login

classitems.description:
Triggered when the logout button is pressed and we attempt to logout of all
student services!
classitems.name: logout

classitems.description: Basic funtion to handle the loading of handlebar templates
Is the transfer page loading?
classitems.name: loading

classitems.description:
Type of searching for Kettering's transfer. Represents the method of 
searching that will be used by the system.
classitems.name: type

classitems.description: Represents the last value the user has searched for in the transfer
classitems.name: lastValue

classitems.description: Represents the last college the user has searched for in the transfer
classitems.name: lastCollege

classitems.description: Is the user currently typing?
classitems.name: typing

classitems.description:
Contains the current list of article DOM <li> tag items that still need
to be added to the DOM (much faster to add all at once after load
is done downloading). This helps prevent the application from seeming to 
hang or become unresponsive.
classitems.name: listQueue

classitems.description:
Contains the last timeout call sent. This allows us to restart the timeout if
the user re-searches in any way (dropdown, or searchbar). The major benefit
of this is that it gives us the feeling of incremental searching, e.g we send
a timeout of some milliseconds whenever the KEY_UP event triggers, as well
as cancelling out the last timeout we sent.
classitems.name: sentTimeout

classitems.description:
Contains the latest separator keyvalue so we can detect when a new
separator is needed.
classitems.name: lastState

classitems.description:
Triggered when the transfer page is first initialized based on jQuery Mobile
pageinit event.
classitems.name: pageInit

classitems.description:
Triggered when the transfer page is first created based on jQuery Mobile
pagecreate event. This is called after the page itself is created but 
before any jQuery Mobile styling is applied.
classitems.name: pageCreate

classitems.description:
Triggered when the user does a key up event in order to simulate incremental
searching for the attached search bar.
classitems.name: incrementalSearch

classitems.description:
Triggered when the user does a direct change. The direct change includes 
typing then changing focus or pressing the clear button. This is redundant
to the incremental search event, *except for the clear button!!*
classitems.name: directSearch

classitems.description:
Triggered when the user does a change to the college drop down box.
When this happens, we need to redo the search.
classitems.name: collegeChange

classitems.description:
Triggered when user chooses the type 'course'. For this we need to rearrange
some of the DOM elements.
classitems.name: changeTypeToCourse

classitems.description:
Triggered when user chooses the type 'college'. For this we need to rearrange
some of the DOM elements.
classitems.name: changeTypeToCollege

classitems.description: Loads and displays the current set of transfer items searched by course.
classitems.name: loadByCourse

classitems.description: Loads and displays the current set of transfer items searched by college.
classitems.name: loadByCollege

classitems.description:
Reinitializes all properties of KUMobile.Transfer as if to restore
a new/default instance.
classitems.name: reinitialize
